alert.note: Alert for Benton; Carroll; Chester; Gibson; Henderson; Henry; Madison (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 1:47PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Henderson, southeastern Gibson, western Benton, Carroll, Madison, southern Henry and northern Chester Counties through 230 PM CDT... At 147 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Atwood to near Blue Goose to near Mercer. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Milan, Lexington, Henderson, McKenzie, Huntingdon, Camden, Natchez Trace State Park, Natchez Trace State Forest, Bruceton, Atwood, Blue Goose, Vale, Mifflin, Bargerton, Wildersville, Springville, Bemis, Jacks Creek and Parkers Crossroads. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM CDT for west Tennessee. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for west Tennessee.

area.areaDesc: Benton; Carroll; Chester; Gibson; Henderson; Henry; Madison
